p: Figure 5 shows the mean dry‐to‐dry transition probability ( P dd) over all observational data sets at each grid cell around the world for both monthly and annual time scales. At the monthly scale, global mean P dd is 0.62 (with [0.58, 0.65] interquartile range) and at annual scale global mean P dd is 0.57 (with [0.54, 0.60] interquartile range). The global means of observed maximum dry spell lengths are 19.1 months and 8.9 years for each time scale.
